title: Las Vegas still struggling against hackers as the weekend arrives
description: Room reservations and sportsbooks were still dark across swaths of Las Vegas on Friday as the community trudged through its fifth day of a battle against hackers who struck the city’s biggest hotel chain.

title: Special counsel asks for 'narrow' gag order for Trump in election interference case
description: Special Counsel Jack Smith is seeking a narrow gag order against former President Donald Trump in the election interference case.

title: Biden won't pardon his son if he's convicted on federal charges, White House says
description: Press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters the president would not pardon or commute Hunter Biden's sentence if he's convicted on federal gun charges.

title: Ashton Kutcher resigns from anti-child sex abuse organization after backlash over Danny Masterson letter
description: Ashton Kutcher has resigned from his role as board chairman of Thorn, a nonprofit he co-founded over a decade ago to combat child sexual exploitation, the actor announced Friday.

title: Trump says he's pleased by Putin's praise: 'I like that he said that'
description: Former President Donald Trump said Thursday that he appreciated recent praise from Russian leader Vladimir Putin.

title: Some gun groups are reveling in the charges against Hunter Biden
description: Gun advocacy groups are hailing the firearms charges brought against Hunter Biden, even though they oppose the laws the president's son is charged with breaking.

title: In impeachment vote, Texas Republicans weigh Ken Paxton's future — and their own
description: Jury deliberations began Friday in Republican Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton’s impeachment trial on charges of corruption and abuse of office.

title: DOJ v. Google: Landmark antitrust case wraps up first week
description: The landmark antitrust trial between the Justice Department and Google wraps up its first week of testimony Friday, with both sides presenting their initial arguments centered on the company’s dominance of internet search.

title: Hackers tied to Las Vegas attacks known for sweet-talking their way into company systems
description: The hackers who are believed to be behind a major cyberattack that has disrupted several casinos and hotels in Las Vegas are part of a small but prolific cybercrime clique whose members have also hit other major U.S. companies in the past year by talking their way into access to computer networks, cybersecurity experts and a person familiar with the hacks said.

title: Biden says he respects United Auto Workers strike after talks collapse
description: The president is expected to deliver remarks Friday about the contract negotiations between the United Auto Workers union and the Big Three auto companies.

title: Is Taylor Swift seeing Travis Kelce? Brother Jason Kelce says, 'Trav is having fun'
description: Philadelphia Eagles center Jason Kelce declined to spill any tea Thursday night about his brother, famed Kansas City Chiefs tight end — and potential Taylor Swift suitor — Travis Kelce.

title: Friday night lights under fire: High school football games are being blitzed by gun violence
description: Gun violence is threatening to dim Friday night lights and endangering a beloved national pastime — high school football games.

title: 'Large and dangerous' Hurricane Lee to bring high winds and coastal flooding to New England
description: Hurricane Lee will bring tropical storm conditions and flooding to parts of coastal New England beginning Friday afternoon, forecasters said, warning that it will be a "large and dangerous storm."

title: TikTok hit with $368 million fine under Europe’s strict data privacy rules
description: European regulators slapped TikTok with a $368 million fine on Friday for failing to protect children’s privacy, the first time that the popular short video-sharing app has been punished for breaching Europe’s strict data privacy rules.

title: 'We saw friends being swept away': Inside Derna, Libya's devastated city
description: The center of the eastern city of Derna is like one big graveyard — a mass of flattened buildings, wrecked lives and upended vehicles after the deadly floods.

title: Critics and allies of Biden point to his son's indictment as proof of their view of the Justice system
description: Hunter Biden was indicted on three felony gun charges on Thursday, a historic first.

title: Where is China's defense minister? Mystery swirls over fate of another top official
description: Chinese Defense Minister Li Shangfu has not been seen in more than two weeks, following the disappearance and replacement of former Foreign Minister Qin Gang.

title: The two forgotten Black boys who died the day of the Birmingham church bombing
description: Outside of Birmingham, Alabama, Johnny Robinson and Virgil Ware have gone largely forgotten in the 60 years they were killed on the say four Black girls were killed in the Sixteenth Street Baptist Church bombing.

title: Trump says he’d testify under oath he never ordered Mar-a-Lago security video deleted
description: Former President Donald Trump said Thursday that he did not order a Mar-a-Lago staffer to delete security video at the center of an investigation into whether he mishandled classified documents.

title: Biden and Trump are both old. So why are voters keying in on only one of them?
description: NBC News interviewed dozens of voters about whether they are concerned about Biden's advanced age — and whether it's as much of an issue for Trump.

title: Warren, Shaheen and Duckworth want to know if Musk limited Ukraine's Starlink access at a crucial point in war with Russia
description: Sens. Warren, Shaheen and Duckworth are asking the U.S. military if Elon Musk limited Ukraine’s access to Starlink at a crucial point in the war with Russia.

title: Auto workers union announces targeted strike if no contract deal is reached by midnight
description: Auto workers union announces targeted strike if no contract deal is reached with Big Three carmakers by midnight

title: Nightly News Full Broadcast (September 14th)
description: Hunter Biden indicted with three federal felony gun charges; Trump speaks in first broadcast interview since leaving White House; Parts of New England preparing for Hurricane Lee’s impact; and more on tonight’s broadcast.
